These services are available year-round and especially during the COVID-19 pandemic; services include: If you are not able to find assistance with the resources listed above, please complete our Student Services & Family Outreach Contact Form and …

div.h4: All Urbandale CSD schools closed for remainder of 2019-20 school year.
div.p: All Urbandale CSD schools are closed; all school-related programs, spring athletics, spring activities, Adventuretime & Community Education classes/programs are cancelled for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. Latest updates here.

input.name: q
input.div: Urbandale will be a school district that brings learning to life for everyone.

div.p: Urbandale CSD Facilitators of Family Outreach (FFOs) provide support and resources for the well-being of students and families. These services are available year-round and especially during the COVID-19 pandemic; services include:

ul.li: If you need assistance finding a childcare provider, Click Here or call 1-855-244-5301

div.p: Get information on resources and updates on what is going on with COVID-19 in your language.

ul.li: Crisis Response Information and phone line in multiple languages Click Here
Get connected to a doctor and resources you need Click Here
Health information in multiple languages Click Here
Health information in multiple languages Click Here
Apply for grant Here

li.br: visit Iowa Workforce Development or call 1-866-239-0843

ul.li: Evelyn K. Davis Center For Working Families Please leave a message at 515-697-7700 or Click Here
Call Center: 866-239-0843 (there may be long waits when you call) Monday- Friday 6:00am-6:30pm and Saturday and Sunday 6:00am-7:30pm, or Apply Here online

li.strong: Iowa DHS Unemployment Information, Temporary Jobs Link

ul.li: Click Here for links to job opportunities
DACA recipients may apply in Iowa

li.strong: COVID-19 United Way Community Economic Relief Fund

ul.li: Call 515-833-2626 to get assistance with bills, rent, and food.
Help with shelter, utilities, food and personal items Click Here
The Iowa Dept of Human Rights has extended this application through May 31, 2020
Call 1-866-674-6327 with questions on existing (LIHEAP) assistance

li.strong: COVID-19 Emergency Relief Program for Veterans, Active Duty Service Members, National Guard and the Reserves

ul.li: Financial assistance with rent, mortgage, auto loan, and utilities and other supports through PenFed Foundation Click Here
Dial “2-1-1” to receive support on any variety of needs you are experiencing

li.strong: Financial Empowerment Center, located at the Evelyn Kay Davis Center

ul.li: Provides FREE financial coaching specific to COVID 19 over the phone. For an Appointment, Click Here
$250 assistance to families with health risks for COVID 19, helping with costs associated with delivered food, medications, transportation, telehealth etc.
Phone applications only at 1-800-675-8416. For more information, Click Here.
Timberline at Meredith (78th and Iltis) 11:00 AM – 11:20 AM
Bristol Ridge (at Fareway) 11:30 AM -11:50 AM
Cross Creek (parking lot) 12:00 PM – 12:30 PM
Jensen Elementary 11:00 AM – 11:20 AM
Karen Acres Elementary 11:30 AM -11:50 AM
Valerius Elementary 12:00 PM – 12:30 PM
Click here for the DMPS resource guide and scroll down to the food assistance info for their pick up locations.
Sterling Point, Chapel Ridge, and Meredith Reformed Church Mondays 12-12:30 pm
Food is distributed on Monday only and it’s enough food for the entire week.
Hours: Thursday 3/19 the UFP will be open Monday, Wednesday, Thursday from 10:00 am – 1:00 pm and 2:00 pm – 5:00 pm. We will be closed on Tuesdays and Saturdays.

li.em: Please bring ID for head of household and each person in the household requiring assistance. They can provide food, personal care products, cold/frozen foods and milk (when available)

a.strong: Updated Food Pantry Hours- Across Metro

ul.li: When: 3:00 PM Monday, Wednesday, Friday (except Plaza Manor which is from 2:30 – 2:50 p.m.)

Where: 4 Locations:
Aldersgate Church (upper parking lot 3600 75th St, Urbandale)
Cross Creek Apartments Meredith & 86th St (ENTER at Iltis Drive entrance)
Jensen Elementary
Rieman Music/Plaza Manor Apartments (Note: time is from 2:30 pm – 2:50 pm)
Instructions: Limited food items, one bag per family. Please drive slowly up to the UCAN volunteer, who will ask how many in your family and then hand you a food bag.

li.strong: Pantries in DM that DO NOT ask for ID

ul.li: Proteus, Friendship Baptist Center, Watchmen, Bond of Unity Food Pantry, Adopt-a-Cause, First Assembly of God, Sandy McNamar Food Pantry, Hope Ankeny, the Cupboard, and Amazing Grace Ministries.
Sambetti’s (1430 2nd Avenue) and Grumpy Goat Tavern (1350 50th St. in WDM)
Drive-Up Service. recipients will receive our delicious Penne Pasta smothered in our Homemade Red Sauce, and loaded with Mozzarella Cheese for NO CHARGE!
For deliver assistance or to learn more please call the Food Bank of Iowa Emergency Food Assistance Hotline: 515-957-2900

li.strong: Free Family Meal (take and bake ) on Sundays at The Station

ul.li: Please call The Station between 11:00 am -1:00 pm to set up a time to pick up between 1:00-3:00 pm.
The Station is located at 3124 Ingersoll Ave, Des Moines, IA 50312.

a.strong: Free/Low-Cost Health Clinics in Polk County

ul.li: If you or a member of your family are experiencing fever, cough, and shortness of breath you may visit the PHC Clinic Monday through Friday, from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. The Clinic is located just south of the Bery Engebretsen Clinic at 2401 SE 14th Street in Des Moines.

li.a: Who Qualifies and How to Apply

ul.li:
If you need help applying- Every Step can help you apply for children or pregnant moms. Call 515-288-1516 to set up an appointment. They have access to multiple languages.
If your child does not qualify for Medicaid, they may Qualify for Hawk-i, which has much higher income guidelines. Call 515-558-6243 for assistance or Click Here .
Those who are at risk or who are currently homeless, contact 515-248-1850 to schedule a Centralized Intake Appointment. Please leave a message and a staff member will return your phone call.

Polk County has set up a homeless shelter @ Youth Inn (Logan Avenue Des Moines, IA 50317) at the Fairgrounds to recover from COVID-19. Includes shelter, food and laundry and supportive medical care. For more information, Click Here.
Helps tenant and Landlords throughout Iowa understand their housing rights and responsibilities through FREE counseling
Call 515-243-1277 or visit Click Here.

A free COVID-19 Legal Information Hotline developed by Iowa Legal Aid in partnership with the Iowa State Bar Association and the Polk County Volunteer Lawyer Project. Iowans experiencing any type of legal problem due to the pandemic, such as facing eviction, being denied unemployment benefits, experiencing employment issues, or being a victim of identity theft, can call 1-800-332-0419. If you want more information Click Here, Online Intake Click Here.

All Urbandale Students, Families, and Employees have 3 free sessions per person through our Employee Assistance Program. You do not need a referral. You can call the number directly, let them know you are an Urbandale School family or employee and request assistance.
For telephone support and scheduling, please call: 800-327-4692 for 24 hour support.
free parenting online course for the month of April. Click Here for more information

Please Pass the Love
free resources and programs for youth and adults to connect and relate with others- for more information Click Here

li.strong: National Alliance on Mental Illness- (NAIMI of Greater Des Moines)

ul.li: Information for mental health supports, including motivational speakers at noon on Wednesdays. For more information Click Here
Crisis Line: 1-800-273-TALK (8255) or text 741741 for a Crisis Text Line

li.strong: Hamilton’s Academy of Grief and Loss-

ul.li: COVID-19 grief resources, including a community resource booklet, lending library, support groups. For more information, Click Here.

li.strong: UnityPoint Health – Des Moines Opening Behavioral Health Urgent Care

ul.li: Beginning April 20, UnityPoint Health – Des Moines is opening and operating a new behavioral health urgent care clinic in central Iowa to provide services to individuals who are needing mental health services, psychiatric evaluation and assessment, addiction medicine, crisis services and community resources. The new UnityPoint Health – Behavioral Health Urgent Care is open 10 a.m. to 8 p.m., 7 days a week and is located at 1250 East 9th Street in Des Moines. This location will serve patients of all ages. Patients younger than 18 years of age must have a guardian with them. Services provided at the new Behavioral Health Urgent Care will include receiving an initial assessment from a licensed mental health clinician and then being connected to appropriate interventions. Additional interventions could include but are not limited to: • Inpatient psychiatric admission • On-site coordination to Eyerly Ball Community Mental Health Services and Orchard Place Child Guidance Center • Connection to other community resources for basic needs. Patients are advised to utilize the Emergency Room instead of the Urgent Care Clinic if they are needing immediate medical attention (i.e. open or fresh wounds), are a minor who does not have a guardian to sign a consent to treat, demonstrating aggressive behavior or having a crisis outside of the hours listed above. For all other behavioral health, psychiatric and addiction related care, patients should access the new Behavioral Health Urgent Care. Click here to learn more about UnityPoint Health Behavioral Health Urgent Care.

Children and Families of Iowa (domestic violence, emergency shelter)
(515) 471-8699
Crisis Line: 1-800-942-0333 (Counties: Polk and Warren)

li.strong: Polk County Crisis and Advocacy Services
li.br:
(domestic violence, sexual abuse)
(515) 286-3600 (24 hour crisis line)
(Counties: Polk and Warren)

ul.li:
U.N.A. (domestic violence, sexual abuse – Latinx Community)
24-Hour Crisis Line: (515) 271-5060
(Counties: Polk, Warren and Marshall)

Monsoon Asians & Pacific Islanders in Solidarity (domestic violence, sexual abuse – Asian/Pacific Islander Community)
24-Hour Crisis Line: (515) 288-0881
Click here for COVID-19 public letter
Click here for policy (Counties: Statewide)

NISAA (domestic abuse, sexual assault – African Immigrant & Refugee Community)
24-Hour Crisis Line: (515) 288-0881
(Counties: Statewide)

RISE (domestic abuse, sexual assault – Native American Community)
(641) 481-0334
(Counties: Statewide)

Transformative Healing (sexual abuse – a safe space for LGBTQIA victims/survivors)
(319) 389-8430
(Counties: Statewide)
Routes have been reduced, but All routes are free

hr.p: If you are not able to find assistance with the resources listed above, please complete our Student Services & Family Outreach Contact Form and we will follow up with you as soon as possible. Thank you!
